lines.text: [first lines]
Good morning. Have you "Conditioned Reflexes"?
Uh...
It's by Pavlov.
Yes... It's out at the moment but if you'd like to leave your name, I could reserve it for you.
Excuse me. Where do they keep the thunder box in this place?
I beg your pardon?
Where does one go if one wants to wash one's hands?
How are you, Lewis? Still peddling trash to the masses?
Yes, that's true, yes... How 'bout you, still writing it?
Hello, Bill. How's it been going? I hope the children didn't give you too much trouble.
No, no... Those two were fine... That Bolk... I had to take him to the lavatory seven times.
Am I to take it then that none of your family have ever been involved with plumbing?

Well, as a matter of fact, my father once had an unfortunate experience on Euston station during the blackout. Uh, what happened was... You see, it was dark at the time and he didn't realize that the train was actually standing at the station at the time... Apart from that, no.
Something to do with his blood, you know. He got to get it into his bloodstream.
Uh, the Pygmies have the same problem. Yes, I quite understand. Well, tell your friend not to worry because relief is on the way.
You know what you're asking for, don't you?
I always thought you were crude, Lewis, but right now you're surpassing even yourself.
...and you're going to get it in a moment, boy-o, and not in blank verse either.
[last lines]
You did very well.
I think I'm definitely improving, don't you?
Oh, you've still got a long way to go.
We both got a long way to go, haven't we? Quite a long drive home, isn't it?

What he does, you see, he puts the canvas on the floor, chucks some whopping great dollops of paint on it and drags a naked woman across it. Yes. Yes. Sort of job I'd like, that. I'd enjoy cleaning the brushes anyway.
